content.question: The position of a particle moving along a straight line at any time t is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>s</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40F7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. What is the acceleration of the particle when <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=xfr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDaiabg2da9iaaisdaaaa@38B1@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?
